name: reforge
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to make or produce something again, for a second, third, etc. time, especially with some difficulty: She is hoping to reforge the once-strong links between the party and the trade unions. A football team representing the European Union will re-forge a sense of solidarity between our respective nations.
More examplesFewer examplesOne of her biggest challenges will be to reforge the country's close ties with its allies.When the party ended, it was time to reforge old friendships.The European Commission president urged member states to use the summit to reforge unity.
